description: Why is there no option to display all albums?! I don't care about the "popular albums" or "random albums" option--just show me all of them ffs. At a certain point the oldest added albums get removed from the "recently added albums" list for me, which is annyoing.

album and artist art issues i have to manually fix.

equalizer is greyed out and i see noway to activate it. support site is a massivepain to lookfor the issue

Plays music in a random order, no option to play albums track byh track. UI is horrible, difficult to make out what each button does, keeps switching between light and dark mode. Dark mode is nice, but light mode is unpolished. Not sure why all controls and strack have to be squashed into the navbar - while wasting so much estate on showing large icons of incorrectly fetched album covers. Uninstalling.
Should replace rhytmbox!
Very nice song player.
Spotify, itunes last.fm, google, integration. party mode, dark theme, hotkeys. minimalistic, functional.
It would be even better if it could be docked in the system tray.
Such a great player. This should just be installed by default.

PROS
1. online music
2. very good music player
3. modern (gtk3 + wayland)
4. supports playing music from youtube
5. resizing it into a small window makes it a into a sort of album art view!
6. full screen mode is also existing
7. sooo many features
8. JUST INSTALL IT 
9. note that youtube-dl should be installed from the terminal to use online functions
CONS
1. none
An outstanding feature rich music player.
This app looks stunning! It works perfectly. Hopefully we will see some more apps of this sort of quality.
No lags, great interface.
As far as music players on Fedora go, this is perfect. I found it very easy to edit metadata and cover art.
I really like this music player. Very simple and intuitive UI, but powerful. I like the online player/lyrics integration
Just works. Very clean iTunes-line UI
It's like Rhythmbox, but not ugly. It's like Gnome Music, but with actual features. Can't seem to sign in to Libre.fm, but that's pretty minor compared to having something that actually works!
summary: Hands down, best media player on Linux

description: It is by far more modern-looking than any other GNOME music player. Not as configurable as Rhythmbox, but all the important options are there.
Basically the best music player on linux.
Cannot get it to import anything including .mp3, .mp4, or .wmv.

To add to what others have said already, this app is beautiful (gtk3 + wayland support), but the online function takes some time to load the music, and there is no "Download" function. If it had a download function, I'd give it a 5 on 5.
WHen resized down to the minimum size should still have close button.
This player is awesome, it need some additions and polish but ... even now it is AWESOME !
summary: Great app, for sure will recommend !

description: This is the Best Music Player application available on linux distro
Stable, looks awesome, functional, great integration with Kid3, has a dark theme... What else do you need? I personally would want more visual customization, but it is not that important
This should definitely replace the default player.
Amazing application.
the perfect app for music. organizes by band, very nice UI and many features others don't have. I used to use Banshee Now its Lollypop.
summary: the best music app by far!

description: Easy to use and really reliable!

Great looking music player, displays album arts and artist pics as well, downloads all automatically, browse collection by album art, and it adds an applet into the gnome shell tray, just like rythmbox does!
lyrics support, party mode, everything! I prefer this over Gnome Music, and think this should be the default
I can't recommend this application enough! Great UI, plays everything, and is easy to use!
Lollypop is simply the best music player on Linux. It has the quality of a AAA software. Cannot recommend it enough!
Looks great, and has all the functionality you need without being overly complicated.
Great UI ,Great UX ,Great app!......its really awesome!

I like to throw some mp3 songs from a pen drive from time to time, and then reorganize them, but to do that I have to do too many steps. I'd love to be able to drag the songs and for them to en queue, then to reorganize them the way I like.
But nevertheless I like it very much. Especially the full screen option. That was a killer idea.
Good job to the dev

+ Really like the proportioning and beauty of the UI
+ all the options I need are activatable
+ Looks great in my favorite Gnome 3 Theme Adapta
+ Works well in Fedora 29
+ This is made with attention to detail
summary: Great UI & works well in Fedora 29 (tested Lollypop 0.9.916)

description: Why did I take so long to find such a great application? Background play support, equalizer with gentle gain and a great look. Do yourself a favour and download this.
Beautiful and fun to use!
Now it's pretty good, not as good as QuodLibet but getting there. Neither can have custom shortcuts so... still lagging behind MusicBee.

Lollypop is a great music player. However, there are many tabs I will never use. The Genres and Years tab are useless for me cause my mp3s aren't tagged currectly, I will never want to use the web tab, and my music collection isn't big enough for the Popular albums tab to be a need. I wish that I could change and configure different tabs to show or hide them. Another thing is there are sometimes pop ups asking me for donations. Once these 2 things are figured out, it will be my main music player, but for now I'm sticking to GNOME music because it feels too bloated.

What a pleasant surprise! This application has exceeded all my expectations. The user interface is very well designed. The cover art view is much better than what other apps offer. It supports smart playlists. It performs well and it's stable. Apart from the plugins, this is miles ahead of RhythmBox and other options. This should be *the* standard.
summary: Looking for a good music player for Gnome/Linux? This is the one

description: only options to select artist or album. no track select. deal breaker for me. uninstalling.

Lollypop established a standard in quality for music player.
It's like the peak performance where iTunes used to be and then adapted a lot of great features! 
I just love it. For the guys out there who are still in love with you own music collection !
No issue..Keep up the great work!
summary: The best open source music player in my opinion.

description: I really liked how back in the days you can just close the player so the interface doesn't annoy you while still being able to play music (think minimise to tray). This functionality was lost even on Windows apps. I love the fact that it's supported again.
This is the most visual of the music apps that I have tried. It has a very nice interface and a really good playback.
No doubt Lollypop is one of the finest music players for the linux world out there and absolutely loved using it. Unfortunately it fails to launch in the new ubuntu 19.10. It keeps crashing
summary: Keep crashing at launch in Eoan Ermine

description: The only knock I could give it would be not being able to see or edit the metadata of the tracks in your library
Simple à utiliser, une interface épurée, un vrai lecteur d'aujourd'hui.
It brought me back to my music...
Does everything perfectly.. wow
This is the best music player if you are using Gnome. I don't know why distros aren't shipping this by default.
It simply just Crashes
I really like seeing album art. Makes navigation much easier and is a feature I missed a lot.
It's just like what rhythmbox used to be for it's era.
I have tried many music players but this is the best one!
click on launch, wait a few seconds, then it closes without any messages;

This app follows the modern GNOME HIG, meaning it fits in perfectly with a native look and feel. But it doesn't just look pretty - it also has great features for managing your music library and discovering old gems you may have forgotten. I love it!
summary: The best music player for GNOME

description: mp4 \mp4a videos

My first Music App that is not iTunes based (since shifting over to Fedora's SilverBlue) and this seems to work so easily. Very surprised at how good it is, especially when picking up the artwork that Catalina's iTunes update lost on its upgrade from Mojave?️
summary: Great Straight Out of The Box - So Impressed!

description: Great app, really comfortable for everyday use (as an usual person).
Has a lot of interesting features including Equalizer, Album art download, online streaming, lyrics display and much more. Loving it a lot!!
summary: Must have this great app for music in Linux

description: Easily the most modern, feature rich music player for Linux.

This is a very light weight app that is very responsive and filled with a lot of features with an easy access.
I wish everything was blended into gnome-music.If Im given a choice though i will pic lollypop

Very nice UI and under a lot of development recently its getting better and better.
Gives a better music experience than any of the GNOME music apps
A one-stop modern beautifully designed music player which is feature-rich, fast and light-weight. What else would you possibly require from a player? Would definitely recommend it.
summary: Does everything you may reuire in a stylish way!

description: Really nice interface, especially if you use Gnome. Nice no nonse feature set and just enough configurability. The onl thing I missed is a possibility to see all tracks as a list, it is organized by albums or genre or year etc. but no flat list option as far as can see.

This app gives a Spotify level of polish to your local music experience. It does one thing, and does it really well. Correction, it does two things. You can actually search online music and play it for free from inside the app, which blew my mind. The design is simple and beautiful, and I love the ability to update the artwork from inside the app.
summary: My best app for local music

description: Almost of display was fault.

Yes this is well thought of music app.
Just one problem - Doesn't play my radio stations
I have tried this on ubuntu and fedora and it's very slow, you can't delete files, and the layout us more designed for looks than function.
summary: Pretty but mediocre functionality, slow with large music collestions

description: Integrated well with gnome overall really good app
Music players are an exceedinlgy personal affair, but for me, Lollypop is the best player in terms of UI and usability.

- Preview doesn't lie, very pretty
- Well made: it uses gnome features nicely
- No bugs
- Radio, lyrics and album covers finders

Good looking, but music play progress bar do not go to mouse press position on music play on progress bar. Have to click on circle and drag it to desired position in progress bar. 
Progress bar is too small. It should go as wide as possible (from program corner to corner), becaouse it will allow more precise skipping.
If arrows used to skipp forward in track it crashes.
If you're looking for a simplistic but relatively feature rich player that has a good design and fits in with Gnome's design guidelines, this is it.
It was recommended on OMG Ubuntu but it is not funtional to me.
summary: I could not find a way to stream internet radio

description: Does not play nice with Lubuntu, player keeps shutting down.
best it does dowload most of artwork and easy to configure
GREATLY RECCOMENDED..SIMILAR TO GROOVE MUSIC LIKE IN WINDOWS!
Great user interface and it just works unlike gnome music. My only issue is that it doesn't download artist pictures for me.

Lollypop recently had a UI overhaul and it functions much better than it did previously. I still find it difficult to figure out how to to navigate the UI, so it's still kind of unintuitive. Still, it has some great features and beats similar applications such as Rhythmbox and GNOME Music. Thank you, Lollypop developers.
summary: Nice application that fits well with GNOME and GTK; Somewhat goofy UI

description: Works well enough for me
Its simple and easy to use
This music app blows the pants off of Rhythm Box and I love Rhythm Box! After giving Lollypop a go, I'll never go back. Seriously Purism, this needs to be the stock application.
summary: Why is this not the default music app in Pure OS?

description:
oh fantastic, thankyou such a wonderful music app, its fast to download and loads very fast, i have a large collection of music (not to large) but this app work's seemingly well, thank you for making such a beautiful app.
would absolutely recommend.

Errors that killed my data were fixed, but didn't bring back my data.
I'd like to use the software, but I don't know how many iterations of this will return. 
See error #454, #434, and others.
summary: Can't use it so long errors lead to complete data loss

description:
Lollypop is the first audio application that I feel really compeates with what iTunes was for me on the Mac. The experience is smooth and comfortable, the interface is relatively polished, and the service integration is very well done.

There are minor bugs from time to time, but these are usually fixed in an update, and lingering bugs are usually because no one has reported them.
It has a very modern and stylish appeal and look.
It works perfectly as a simple music player, and has a great mobile interface, too.
It could use a little bit of UI/UX rework but generally the best music player for GNOME with an active development.
summary: Easy to use and feature complete

description: some polish is still needed, but overall this is an amazing player with a nice UI.
summary: Very intuitive and clean music player

description: I used for years AIMP under Windows 7 with upsampling plugin to output 192Khz/32bit to DAC . Searrching for a decent audio player I consider Lollypop as the best player for Ubuntu. Just a little annoying thing: sometimes when I use the volume control of the app there are "pops". I regret the removal of the radio function... Adding a feature to browse the library by folders and skin support would be great! Anyway still the best ! Merci Cédric !
summary: My favorite audio player for Ubuntu

description: which very basic
summary: can't get a view for the playing queue

description:
Install, launch, go to recently added, crash. 
Once crashed once, will always crash on launch.
It is getting better over time

As of the time of this review, it's crashing on Ubuntu 20.04 Focal. Install fresh, before it can scan the directory for music, it crashes. Reopen, can see it's scanned some of the files, but again will crash.
May be great for online, so all the reviews above say... But I have thousands of songs on my a drive (approx 15 000) and it sucks adding them to a play list. Very counter-intuitive.
Good sound quality and UI

After they got the install problems fixed with Ubuntu 20.04.1 LTS, it is working wonderfully. I love this app because it allows my to play my 35+ GB of local network storage music and allows me to see lyrics as well if I so desire. I think this really is the best player for Linux.
Ein super Programm welches sich wie kein anderes in den Gnome Desktop integriert. Kann alles was man für seine Musiksammlung so braucht, einfach toll!

Der Lollypop Musik Player ist super, er besitzt eine schöne Übersicht der Interpreten, unterstützt Künstlerbilder und bietet sogar die Möglichkeit Kompilationen in die Bibliothek zu integrieren, ohne dass man 24 neue Interpreten in die Liste bekommt. Klare Empfehlung für jeden, der eine klar strukturierte Bibliothek sucht.

Sehr guter Musikplayer der oft neue Funktionen dazu bekommt.
Equalizer zB.  Für die GNOME Welt Perfekt.  Auch auf kleineren Displays gut verwendbar da beim skalieren sich die Oberfläche in Desktop sowie mobile Version verwandelt.

Ich suchte eine modernere Alternative zu Rhythmbox und wurde hier fündig. Schön, dass Lollypop jetzt endlich auch in den offiziellen Fedora-Repos zu finden ist. 

Die App ist wunderbar übersichtlich und passt super in die GNOME-DE. Besonders gut gefällt mir die Integration der Internetradio-Funktion. Lupe klicken, Name der Station eingeben, aufs Plus klicken, und schon hat man eine ganze Senderbibliothek. Die Funktion findet so gut wie jeden Sender. Wird mit jedem Update besser

Einfach das beste aus allen bekannten Musikplayer zusammengefasst und daraus einen stabilen, leistungsstarken, schönen Musikplayer gemacht. Die Online Musik Funktion ist wirklich einzigartig und super! Ich nutze kaum noch spotify! Und dann noch FOSS! Ach man könnte sich so darüber freuen ))
...ein guter Nachfolger für den alten gmusicbrowser --rip :(
wird ständig aktualisiert vielen Dank an den (die) Programierer
Lollypop ist an und für sich ok, wenn auch etwas unübersichtlich was die Wiedergabe angeht. Die Probleme sind aber, dass es lahm ist wie sonst was und ständig die Musik stehen bleibt.
Just happened to stumble upon on in my Ubuntu Software Manager and bam, hooked!

Simple but efficient music player. Slim and easy to user UI design. All the functions I care are there. After a long journey to find a slim but well designed music app I finally found my absolute favorite.
summary: The music player I was looking for

description: Die App is ganz gut gemacht. Läuft auch soweit ganz gut wenn man nur paar Lieder in der Musiksammlung hat. Aber bei ca. 30.000 mp3s. Ist die App total überfordert. Schade. Macht einen sehr guten Eindruck. Mann müsste halt an der Performanceschrauben ganz schön was machen.
unfortunalety it cannot handle large music collections (app collapses before the collection scan is finished).
aber ändert das iconlogo ....
Kann nicht auf ein Unterverzeichnis einer Speicherkarte zugreifen!
Ein zeitgemäßer Musikplayer, der einfach macht was er soll...! Mit guten Vollbildmodus. Beherrscht große Musiksammlung, ohne Programm-Absturz, wie man es ja von anderen Playern unter Linux kennt.
kryptisches userinterface
summary: nein das ist keine gute bedienung

description: THe interface freezes a lot when playing music from such a hughe music collection plus it randomly crashes when navigating the UI if it reacts to anything ...
summary: Lags on hughe music collections (4000 titles plus)

description: Irgendwie sieht das alles modern und toll aus aber es ist keine angenehme Steuerung und einfachste Tätigkeiten, wie Lieder in eine Playlist zu bringen war schon unnötig kompliziert

Un placer a la vista, permite visualizar portadas de discos, fotos de artistas y acceder a información sobre cada músico, además de interconectarse con editores tag para actualizar o modificar info de cada disco.
Reproductores de audio para Linux hay muchos, pero éste es uno de los mejores.

Es el reproductor mas bonito y llamativo que he usado en linux y tiene una interfaz muy cuidada
(lo único malo que le veo es que los servicios de streaming siguen un poco verdes lo que ocasiona que a veces crashee o se quede colgado al buscar)
summary: Falta pulirlo un poco mas, luego sera hermoso XD

description: Salió la portada de mi grupo favorito EELS por eso lo instale y me fascino.
Pero de todas las que he probado, que han sido muchas, sin duda es la mejor.
summary: Todavía le quedan algunas cosas por pulir

description: Me gusta mucho, funciona muy bien, tiene muy buen aspecto y las funcionalidades que busco.
Excelente software que destaca por encima de los demás por su impecable interfaz y su amplia gama de características.
summary: La mejor interfaz para un reproductor de audio en GNU/Linux

description: busque y busqque y este es el mejor, si quieren estética y rapidez y una buena organizacion de su musica no lo piensen mas e instalenlo

Es realmente buena y encuentra la información y carátulas de casi todas mis canciones. El hecho de poder conectarla a la red es un gran acierto pero tiene también cosas que pulir: facilitar la creación de listas de reproducción desde carpetas con drag and drop y mostrar "carpetas" en las etiquetas donde figuran "artistas", "álbunes", etc. Además si le añades una gran cantidad de pistas desde el explorador se colapsa. Y por último, aunque pasa muy pocas veces, si empiezas a buscar información de canciones mientras estás escuchando algo se cierra sin explicaciones.

Se me hacía dificil cambiarme, sobretodo por las nuevas opciones de RTM, pero la calidad de diseño y funciones me hicieron cambiar definitivamente. Al principio tuve problemas con los formatos y con conectar al NAS de audio, pero simplemente es una demora de conexión.
Excelente reproductor muy versatil y con una interfaz muy agil

La aplicación se cierra al intentar abrirla en Kubuntu 20.04 LTS. Al ejecutarla desde la terminal genera este salida al momento de crash: File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/lollypop/helper_art.py", line 147, in _on_get_artwork_pixbuf
  surface = Gdk.cairo_surface_create_from_pixbuf(
TypeError: Couldn't find foreign struct converter for 'cairo.Surface'.
Espero que mejoren el error, tengo 2 equipos con Kubuntu a menos que este error sólo afecte a KDE.
summary: La aplicación se cierra en Kubuntu 20.04

description: Me parece increible el nivel de integración con gnome. Mil gracias
Muestra el listado de mi música con fotos de cada álbum. Escucho mi música desde mi disco duro como si fuese Spotify.

es asombroso es muy minimalista y tiene un estilo fluent
me encanta
la estoy probando

el reproductor de musica que viene por defecto instalado no es representativo de la calidad del sistema operativo. Esta aplicacion es la que deberia venir con la instalacion inicial del sistema, es moderna y sencilla a la vez, sin mucha complicacion para su instalacion, funciona a la perfeccion. LA RECOMIENDO
después de instalar ubuntu instalo esta app

La verdad es buena, solo el icono de la app no me gusta mucho, pero en cuanto funcionalidad es de las mejores, algo así debería ser la app de gnome-music (quizas con menos opciones y apartados porque busca la simpleza), pero en si es la mejor de momento...

Es bien intuitiva y cumple con muchas facetas para reproducir audio sin perdida. Tiene una buena gestion y organizacion de la musica y un una buena gestion de sonido en general. El unico tema es el icono de la app, no le hace gala a su interfaz grafica.
Me encanta mucho la aplicación, pero creo que sería mucho mejor si le implementaran la opción para ver todas las canciones a parte de la opción de ver todos los álbunes
summary: Estaría mejor con un modo para ver todas las canciones

description: Esta muy bien, ligera y configurable al maximo. solo que en ubuntu Budgie no me activa el MODO OSCURO a menos que inicie el programa desde la consola. alguna solucion?

Visual y operativamente es muy amigable. Tiene muchas funciones interesantes para sacar el máximo provecho a una biblioteca musical. Lo objetable si es que no se encuentra en la tienda de Linux, por lo que hay que instarla desde la página misma. Fuera de esto excelente reproductor de música con exquisito sonido.
summary: La mejor aplicación de música que he encontrado en Linux

description: Muy buena funciona de 10 y la apariencia es excelente
muy buena aplicación aunque se puede pulir más. en varias distribuciones no se puede visualizar en modo obscuro.
Una aplicación que tiene todo lo que busco de un reproductor de música.
summary: Lo mejor que he probado hasta ahora

description:
A la aplicación le falta la mitad de cosas que necesito de un reproductor de música. 
Le falta poder editar los metadatos de las canciones y en ellos las caratulas de cada canción además de mostrar las carátulas por canción y no solo la carátula por album con lo que no puedes tener varias carátulas por álbum.
summary: Muy lejos del iTunes que había ya en 2007

description: He utilizado la app por varios años en entorno Xfce y ahora en Manjaro KDE con algunos problemas con la decoración de ventanas GTK, no obstante su desempeño es óptimo, tiene una GUI moderna similar al reproductor iTunes y no consume muchos recursos del sistema. Tengo mi fonoteca en un disco externo de 500 GB y al abrir es rápido.

Se integra muy bién. Se pueden configurar varias cosas como la importación, equalizador, caratulas etc, como en otros reproductores. Se que le faltan cosas pero para mi de lo que se trata es de manejarte por las bibliotecas reproduciendo audio de calidad y suficiente. De hecho , tiene mas cosas de las que yo pensaba ya que he probado algún otro reproductor pero me quedo con este por la fenomenal integración en Gnome.
summary: Bien integrado con Gnome 40. Muy aceptable

description: Tiene todo lo que necesito y lo mejor es que se integra a la perfección con la apariencia de Gnome
En la ultima version de ubuntu se congela y congela el ecritorio, solo sucede cuando esta activo el reproductor lollypop
lo estoy usando en fedora 34 gnome 40 y funciona como la luz, tengo mas de 70.000 canciones 2.000 discos y casi 600 artistas y funciona de diez.
No estoy exagerando cuando digo que es una de las mejores aplicaciones de música que he probado.
Exelente reproductor lo recomiendo ampliamente
summary: Creo ue es el mejor reproductor de musica

description:
Al intentar reproducir una canción de las sugerencias dice que No se encuentra en Youtube y en la reproducción Web dice: No hay nada por aquí.
¿Cómo se resuelve esto?
summary: No encuentra la canción en Youtube ni funciona la web

description: excelente app thanks

Es el Mejor reproductor de música que e instalado en toda mi larga vida, tengo 44 años y simplemente maneja una cantidad exorbitante de información y aun así es capaz de ser tan fluido, me gustaria saber como exportar musica a un pendrive o a un reproductor de musica externo o celular, sin embargo, sigue siendo mi favorito.
summary: Es el Mejor reproductor de musica

description: Perfecto cumple lo que dice, usandolo en fedora 36 gnome 42.2 perfectamente ,agil,estable un 10.
Eso, esto hace que tenga que estar adivinando cual musica/genero es la que estoy eligiendo, lo cual lo hace un pcoo molesto. Fuera de eso, es una buena aplicación.
summary: Esta bastante buena, pero no me deja crear listas propias

description: Se integra perfectamente en gnome, ofrece muchas opciones, reconoce perfectamente albumes. Solo hecho en falta una opción de "Todas las pistas"

Espectacular. Plenamente satisfecho con la apariencia y con las prestaciones.
Ubuntu necesita una modernización en su reproductor por defecto.
Un pequeño punto en contra: me muestra la letra de muy pocas canciones de mi colección.
summary: Debe venir por defecto en Ubuntu

description: Interface différente, mais rien à redire, fait le boulot et le fait bien.
Interface au top, n'a pas peur des grosses bibliothèques musicales. Permet aussi de faire des recherches sur le web. Au top!
Interface intuitive et très fonctionnelle, beaucoup d'option pour gérer ses collections de titres et d'album. Très esthétique et agréable à utiliser!
Bien meilleure que gnome music, ou rhythmbox, ou quoi que ce soit d'autre.
Ne tourne pas sous Fedora 26 :(
La meilleur application de gestion de musique de gnome. En gtk3 ,superbement intégré.Merci beaucoup a gnumdk pour ce très beau travail :+1:
Simple d'utilisation mais ne perd pas en efficacité. Belle interface simple et intuitive.
summary: Bon lecteur et audio et belle interface

description: Belle ergonomie Lollypop correspond parfaitement à mes attentes. Merci à ses concepteurs!
Affichage pochette, lecture web depuis Youtube, radio ect
summary: Le plus beau, le plus simple

description: Belle interface. Lollypop vous demandera quelques minutes pour découvrir ses fonctions, certaines n'étant pas évidente à trouver. Autrement, RAS, très bon logiciel.

Le top pour moi sur fedora 29.
Bien intégré à gnome.
Belle évolution à chaque update.

Lecteur de musique sublime à la fois simple et puissant. S’intègre parfaitement dans Gnome.
L'essayer c'est l'adopter !
Je n'ai jamais vu un lecteur aussi abouti !
un grand merci au développeur
Irréprochable, mis à jour régulièrement

Je cherchais depuis des lustres un équivalent à Itunes sur Ubuntu avec affichage des pochettes. 
Je suis tombé sur LollyPop est j'ai tout de suite adoré.
Encore mieux que Itunes, manque juste la possibilité de faire des dossiers.
J'encourage le concepteur et dis Bravo!
Enfin, simplicité et élégance
Bravo au développeur !
C'est Juste Le Meilleur Lecteur De Musique !!
tres bon logiciel depuis les mises a jour
summary: tres bon logiciel depuis ca mise a jour

description:
Pas encore le iTunes pour Linux mais on s'en approche bien ! 
manque JUSTE l'édition des meta-infos et on y est 
En tout cas n'a pas trop bronché sur la taille de ma disothèque, est joli, fait le job, bref allez-y !
Interface moderne et très intuitive
Il manque juste la possibilité de modifier les tags et c'est parfait

C'est (presque) tout ce dont on pourrait rêver pour un lecteur de musique. Il ne manque que l'édition de tags, mais on s'en passe bien volontiers quand on voit l'éventail de fonctionnalités que propose Lollypop.
Je recommande !
Pour ma part je l'utilise sous KDE, je l'ai utilisé aussi avec Gnome, il a sa place sur n'importe quel bureau, c'est le meilleur. Un look moderne et agréable, très intuitif, un must.

Le lecteur semble chouette mais impossible de mettre/trouver ses propres radios internet ? Il n'y a qu'un mode web et un mode rechercher, mais uniquement poiur rechercher des titres ou des albums. K'ai cherché partout sur internet pour trouver comment faire j'ai absolument rien trouvé. Un site parle d'onglet radio mais il n'existe pas !

Au départ, lecture des musique normale
Puis lecture aléatoire des musique
vous cliquez sur une musique, il en met une autre
et ainsi de suite
C'est compliqué
j'ai besoin d'un lecteur conviviable et qui fonctionne correctement
Gapless et plein de fonctionnalités, j'adore.
Вопросов не возникает.
Раньше радио было, зачем убрали, очень жаль.
Очень не хватает радио...
Радио - правая кнопка мыши на категориях в левой части и ставим нужную галку.
Лучшее, что можно найти для gtk
Установлены все необходимые компоненты, данные профиля last.fm введены в настройках, при нажатии кнопки подключение ничего не происходит.
Очень хороший плеер, в нём нет ничего лишнего и со своей задачей он справляется на отлично.
Ну не может быть, чтобы воспроизведение шло только по альбомам и нельзя было в случайном порядке воспроизводить мессиво из аудиофайлов, но...хрен поймешь, как это сделать.
очень красивый и простой плеер

Хорошее современное приложение, много функционала, что не может не радовать.
Единственный минус - это отсутствие вменяемого списка воспроизведения.
Сейчас у меня он называется "Воспроизведение альбомов", где есть не понятная функция "добавить"(выглядит как иконка файла с плюсом).

При закрытии программы не восстанавливается список воспроизведения, несмотря на то, что опция "Восстанавливать состояние при запуске" включена.

Если бы не эти важные для меня недоработки, поставил бы 5 звёзд за минимализм в дизайне и богатый функционал.
для просто проиграть музыку - отличное приложение.
Очень неудобно, что нету просто списка песен. Нужно обязательно искать их по уже непонятно как распределенным местам. Ужасно
Хороший плеер для MP3, но FLAC просто не видит.... Очень жаль.
Интерфейс красивый и удобный, таких не много. Но списка всех песен в нём нет - это неудобно.
Вроде нормальный плеер, но не понятно как в него импортировать или добавлять музыку.
но не все предсказуемо работает
After i have choosen music folder the application always crashes on lauch

Первый раз я использовал этот плеер в Linux Mint 20.2 Cinnamon в виде flatpak-пакета. Всё понравилось, удобное управление воспроизведением музыки. Фоновое воспроизведение также поддерживается.

Теперь использую на Ubuntu 21.04
summary: Lollypop - лучшее приложение, которое я когда-либо использовал!

description:
Lollypop — единственный, близкий по функциям к MusicBee, из того что удалось найти под Linux, хотя пока сыроват. Надеюсь проект будет развиваться.

Минусы на данный момент: 
Довольно странная, не интуитивная работа с плейлистом и воспроизведением.
Не хватает возможности редактирования и просмотра тегов трека и альбома.
Скробблинг у меня не заработал ни с last.fm ни с libre.fm - настройки как-будто не сохраняются.

Замечательный плеер. Чтобы добавить трек переносишь в папку ,,Музыка,, и все. Если есть желание посмотреть все свои треки заходишь в ,,Плейлисты,, выбираешь в подменю .,Все треки,, ставишь галочку и появляется плейлист с полным содержанием папки ,,Музыка,,
нормалек нормалек
ништяк ништяк,тема
Работает исправно + Хорошо вписывается в интерфейс Gnome.
Самый лучший плеер для Linux имхо.
